content:
There are several surreal locations in Illinois that could make for interesting sets in a film or TV production. Here are a few possibilities:

1. Cahokia Mounds: This historic site near Collinsville, Illinois, features the remains of an ancient Native American city, including mounds that were used for religious and ceremonial purposes. The site has a mystical quality that could lend itself well to a surreal or mystical film.
2. Garden of the Gods: Located in southern Illinois, this rock formation has a striking, otherworldly appearance that could work well in a science fiction or fantasy film.
3. The Illinois Beach Resort: This lakeside resort in Zion, Illinois, has a retro, 1950s vibe that could work well in a period piece or a surreal film.
4. The Indiana Dunes: Just across the border from Illinois in Indiana, the dunes offer a unique landscape that could be used in a variety of genres, from westerns to science fiction.
5. The abandoned Joliet Correctional Center: This former prison in Joliet, Illinois, has a haunting, eerie quality that could be perfect for a horror film or thriller.

Of course, there may be other locations in Illinois that would work well depending on the specific needs of your production.
